content: Singaporean sociologistThis biography of a living person **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help by adding reliable sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately** from the article and its talk page, especially if potentially libelous. *Find sources:* "Vincent Chua" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(July 2015)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Vincent Chua** is a Singaporean [Sociologist](/wiki/Sociologist). He is an assistant professor in the Department of Sociology at the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore). Vincent Chua received his PhD in sociology from the [University of Toronto](/wiki/University_of_Toronto) in November 2010. His research interests are in social networks and social capital, social support, education, neighbourhoods and ethnic stratification. He is interested in how institutional factors such as labour markets and education affect the job search and networking practices of people. This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. title: Vincent Chua
